definition: to bewitch/to enchant/to cast a spell over sb
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
stratagem to trap sb/to bewitch and trap
potion that makes the soul forget its previous life/(fig.) words or actions intended to attract sb's interest
to butter sb up/to try to impress sb
a kind of sleeping gas or smoke used by thieves to incapacitate victims

sentences.english: You let your brother give her roofies?
sentences.chinese: 你讓你哥給她下迷魂藥？

sentences.english: The maze trap village has always kept the original pattern for 2000 years.
sentences.chinese: 二千年來，迷魂陣村始終保留着原格局。

sentences.english: That all has its place along with the "maze dance"; but patience.
sentences.chinese: 那一切以及“迷魂舞”都有自己的位置，但要耐心。

sentences.english: The robbers went different ways hoping to put the sheriffs men off the scent.
sentences.chinese: 那夥強盜分路逃走，企圖給警察佈下迷魂陣。

sentences.english: Chic flash abidjan has become the siren of west africa.
sentences.chinese: 時髦奢華的阿比讓已成爲西非紙醉金迷的迷魂窟。

definition: a kind of sleeping gas or smoke used by thieves to incapacitate victims
arch. legendary venomous insect/to poison/to bewitch/to drive to insanity/to harm by witchcraft/intestinal parasite
to promote estrus/to bring an animal to heat by artificial means
to hinder the eyesight/(fig.) to trick into not noticing/to blindfold
